qas.question: How does the mental health profession approach efforts to change sexual orientation?
What do these policy statements suggest?

answers.text: cautioning the profession and the public about treatments that purport to change sexual orientation

qas.question: What are some of the organizations that have released policy statements?

answers.text: National Association of Social Workers in the USA, the Royal College of Psychiatrists, and the Australian Psychological Society.

qas.question: Are their any mental health proffesionals that have programs to change sexual orientation?

answers.text: No major mental health professional organization has sanctioned efforts to change sexual orientation

qas.question: What policy statement has almost all proffesionals applied to their practices?

answers.text: cautioning the profession and the public about treatments that purport to change sexual orientation.

qas.question: What are some professional associations that do not offer changing sexual orientation programs?

answers.text: the American Psychiatric Association, American Psychological Association, American Counseling Association,

context: <a3_0>No major mental health professional organization has sanctioned efforts to change sexual orientation<a3_0/> and virtually all of them <a0_0>have adopted policy statements<a0_0/> <a1_0><a4_0>cautioning the profession and the public about treatments that purport to change sexual orientation<a1_0/>.<a4_0/> These include <a5_0>the American Psychiatric Association, American Psychological Association, American Counseling Association,<a5_0/> <a2_0>National Association of Social Workers in the USA, the Royal College of Psychiatrists, and the Australian Psychological Society.
